greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Convert the primorial base expansion of n into its prime product form, then divide by the largest primorial which divides that product: a(n) = A111701(A276086(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2559
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 0..32768
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: A111701(n) = forprime(p=2, , if(n%p, return(n), n /= p));
A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 19 2019
